headline: The New York Times hates any conservative: GOP Ohio Senate candidate
author: Fox News Staff
sentences: Cleveland businessman and leading Republican Senate candidate Mike Gibbons joins FOX News Radio's Jessica Rosenthal to discuss past controversial comments, specifically about people of Asian descent, and more on "The Fox News Rundown."

JESSICA ROSENTHAL: I want to ask about capitalizing on your momentum and any obstacles you see because there are – have been – some recent reports about some of the comments you made in the past that some have found offensive.
I guess it was in 2013, you were in college classes, you said, with many Asian - people of Asian descent – you said that you found them to be incredibly bright but memorized things, mostly.

OHIO SENATE RACE: GIBBONS LAUNCHES NEW AD BLITZ TO GIVE VOTERS A BEHIND THE SCENES LOOK
MIKE GIBBONS: Well, first of all, I'm not going to get involved in this cancel culture baloney.

CLICK BELOW TO LISTEN TO THE FULL EPISODE OF "THE FOX NEWS RUNDOWN":
New episodes of "The Fox News Rundown" are available now and can be downloaded at foxnewspodcasts.com.
And, you know what, Donald Trump was canceled because he mandated, or he put border protections on during the virus and that was considered racist.
GIBBONS: What I was saying is I did not believe Chinese education stood up to the innovation that we teach here in America.
So, maybe you can take this opportunity to clarify that business discussion and the differences between education.
And it was a business program, and we were discussing the virtues of American education over Chinese education.
Because I imagine if you do serve as senator, then you might have opportunities to talk about education.
Yeah, I felt that they had a different, you know, to use another woke word, "pedagogy" than we have.
What would you like to see in terms of American education versus, I guess, Chinese education?
ROSENTHAL: Well, some Asian advocacy groups have said that they found the remarks offensive.
That comment was made in a completely different kind of context, a business context.
And I believe that's why America will eventually succeed where China will not.
And I'm not going to get into the New York Times, who hates any conservative.
I can tell you this, I wasn't referring to any racial group at all.
You can correct me if I'm incorrectly stating what you said.
This is why good people don't run for office, by the way.
ROSENTHAL: Well, talk to me, then, about education.
And I mean, they teach people differently.
They don't give anybody a fair shot.
You know, I subscribe to the paper.
It is completely out of context.
I was referring to a country.
It is absolutely ridiculous.
GIBBONS: You know what?
It's in the same vein.
